snippet: The vote, which is not binding, is the first time that investors at one of the nation’s largest banks have rejected a board’s compensation plan.
abstract: The vote, which is not binding, is the first time that investors at one of the nation’s largest banks have rejected a board’s compensation plan.

byline.original: By JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG and NELSON D. SCHWARTZ

headline.main: Citigroup's Chief Rebuffed on Pay by Shareholders
headline.print_headline: Citigroup’s Chief Rebuffed On Pay By Shareholders
